GenAiFunction.description:
Store a learning when you notice: - User corrects you: "No, use Revenue not Amount", "That's not what I meant", "Actually..." - User refines output: "Sort that by close date", "Can you also include..." - User states preference: "always", "from now on", "I prefer", "don't do X" - User shows dissatisfaction: "not quite", "try again", "wrong", rephrasing same request
Format memories as OBSERVATIONS about the user, not commands to yourself: - Good: "When showing opportunities, user prefers Amount and CloseDate included" - Bad: "When showing opportunities, include Amount and CloseDate"
Include a brief example reference when it fits (keeps memories actionable): - With example: "When showing pipeline, user prefers tables (like the January forecast)" - Without: "When showing pipeline, user prefers tables with Amount, Stage, CloseDate"
Summary (max 80 chars): Brief description like "Prefers tables for pipeline data" Instruction (max 255 chars): "When [context], user prefers [preference]" + optional short example reference
After storing, confirm and immediately apply the preference.
